subject: RE: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Some things are just mature enough that there is no need for more releases. With such a big user base - hell, actually being the pseudo standard for unit
messageBody:
Bill de hSra wrote:

> It's not about that, it's about who has commit access. Junit 3.8,1
> was release in Sept 2002. As such it looks like a dead/abandoned
> project to me.

Some things are just mature enough that there is no need for more
releases. With such a big user base - hell, actually being the pseudo
standard for unit testing in Java - I find it strange to think of it as
"dead".

Puzzled, Ilja
